name: SetAllowedActionsEnterprise
description:
Configure allowed GitHub Actions for an enterprise.

This tool sets the allowed GitHub Actions for a given enterprise. It is used when the enterprise's permission policy for `allowed_actions` is set to `selected`. Requires authentication with an `admin:enterprise` scope token.

parameters.name: enterprise_identifier
parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name or the enterprise ID.

value_schema.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

parameters.name: allowed_action_patterns
parameters.description: List of patterns to match specific GitHub Actions to allow. Use wildcards, tags, and SHAs for specification.

value_schema.description: Specifies a list of string-matching patterns to allow specific action(s). Wildcards, tags, and SHAs are allowed. For example, `monalisa/octocat@*`, `monalisa/octocat@v2`, `monalisa/*`.

parameters.name: allow_github_owned_actions
parameters.description: Set to true to allow GitHub-owned actions in the enterprise, such as those in the 'actions' organization.

value_schema.description: Whether GitHub-owned actions are allowed. For example, this includes the actions in the `actions` organization.
